data.title: The worst in the series?
data.meta_description: With the addition of stupid ideas such as trafic checking, the game changed from fast paced racing with big crashes to focusing on the crashes and lea

#16 Edited By falconer

DanCarmichael said:

"The achievements are an absolute joke though. Far too hard.

"

Hardly. I have all of them but the signature takedowns (always sucked at them) one. You just have to grind and give it more than a couple tries. :)

My list of the Burnout series:

1) Burnout 2: Point of Impact

2) Burnout Paradise

3) Burnout 3: Takedown

4) Burnout Revenge

5) Burnout

#20 Edited By Demyx

Paradise really went into an entirely different direction, and I miss the old style. But I still really liked Paradise.

I like every game in the series, Takedown is the best though. I even like the soundtrack.

#25 Edited By CoolDrMoney

I really liked Revenge, though not as much as Takedown. But yeah, the soundtrack was terrible, even worse than Takedown's.

I thought the first Burnout was easily the weakest, though I didn't enjoy the Paradise demo too much. I'm looking to check it out at a budget price eventually

#26 Edited By Gameboi

It's such a hard call for me. I hated the open-endedness of Paradise (trying to read and navigate by street signs with an SDTV didn't help matters), yet it's hard to hate on a game that has released so much extra (and free) content after its release. I still think Takedown is the highlight of the series, although Revenge is pretty good.
